landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges Plaintiff entered possession of the basement unit and pays $1,200/month rent to Defendant (¶4), and identifies Defendant as the owner/landlord of the Premises (¶2), establishing a landlord–tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges affirmative omissions and acts by Defendant: failure to repair or abate water intrusion after notice (¶6–7, ¶12), damaging tenant property by permitting continued leakage (¶9, ¶13), and threatening nonrenewal/labeling tenant a “problem tenant” (¶11, ¶13, ¶19).

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges ongoing water intrusion and dampness that persisted after notice (¶6–8, ¶12), resulting in property damage (~$400) (¶9), continuous dehumidifier use and increased utility costs (¶10), and emotional/inconvenience harms (¶13, ¶20), which sufficiently plead a substantial interference with use and enjoyment.

causation.reasoning: Complaint alleges tenant notified Defendant of the leak (¶6), Defendant failed to take meaningful remedial action (¶7, ¶12), the leakage continued and caused the stated harms (¶7–10, ¶13), linking the landlord’s conduct/omission to the interference and resulting damage.

damages.reasoning: Complaint specifically alleges actual damages: approximately $400 in property damage (¶9, ¶20(a)), increased electric costs from continuous dehumidifier use (¶10, ¶20(b)), and claims of inconvenience and emotional distress (¶13, ¶20(c)), sufficient to plead damages.
